title: Index Swing Trades: Watch The Data And Volatility
text:
Now that each of our 3 index trades hit their final targets this week ( , and ), matters could become a little less straightforward for swing traders. The next 3 weeks will be dominated by data-watching and volatility, looking for any hints regarding the Fed's October 30 .

Some say we could retest 2967-70 on the SPX, others are focusing on 26570 on the DOW 30. The urgency for an October rate cut (raised by the ISMs) was removed by Friday's mixed US . But while the urgency for a cut may have gone away, the possibility very much remains. At this point, a violent surge in and resurfacing trade threats from Trump are more likely to trigger an October cut than are macro news.

Technically, the charts below (from Sept. 26) are a reminder that technicals do work, when backed by other relevant technical and sometimes fundamental factors.
description: Stocks Analysis by Ashraf Laidi covering: S&P 500, DAX, Dow Jones 30 Futures, CBOE Volatility Index. Read Ashraf Laidi's latest article on Investing.com
